TopicTitle: How come Kerbals wear mittens instead of gloves?

Articles.Content:
We've seen that they have fingers, so it's not like they have mitten-hands, so, what's the real or at least the canon reason for why they have mittens for gloves rather than actual gloves? which struck me as a bit odd.

As for real reasons, I would guess it's probably just a lot easier to animate.

It is for restricting their button pressing power to either "one at a time" or "all of them at once". You don't want Jeb to play piano on the control panel. You want Jeb to either fly it methodically or slam the panic button.
On a less serious note, possibly their space suit tech isn't advanced enough to allow two layers of suit to fit between their fingers? Except between the thumb and index finger of course.
Forum rule number 2.2 k. Do not question the mittens.

Mittens are said to be more warm than gloves.

Perhaps Kerbals have a low tollerance for cold since they also seem to always wear spacesuits.

It's because the Kerbals can't breathe outside air. They actually ARE aliens that landed on Kerbin after their interstellar trip. That's why the rest of Kerbin is abandoned... the main purpose of their KSC land base was to send and receive shipments from the home-world, but an unknown disaster cut off all communications. Now they're using the launch facilities to explore their new solar system, and someday maybe even return home...
